t: Luke 16
The Parable of the Dishonest Manager
He*p also said to the disciples, “There*r was*r a*r rich*r man*r who*r had*r a*r manager,*r and*r charges*r were*r brought*r to*r him*r that*r this*r man*r was*r wasting*r his*r possessions.*r

And*r he*r called*r him*r and*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘What*r is*r this*r that*r I*r hear*r about*r you?*r Turn*r in*r the*r account*r of*r your*r management,*r for*r you*r can*r no*r longer*r be*r manager.’*r

And*r the*r manager*r said*r to*r himself,*r ‘What*r shall*r I*r do,*r since*r my*r master*r is*r taking*r the*r management*r away*r from*r me?*r I*r am*r not*r strong*r enough*r to*r dig,*r and*r I*r am*r ashamed*r to*r beg.*r
I*r have*r decided*r what*r to*r do,*r so*r that*r when*r I*r am*r removed*r from*r management,*r people*r may*r receive*r me*r into*r their*r houses.’*r
So,*r summoning*r his*r master’s*r debtors*r one*r by*r one,*r he*r said*r to*r the*r first,*r ‘How*r much*r do*r you*r owe*r my*r master?’*r
He*r said,*r ‘A*r hundred*r measures*r of*r oil.’*r He*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Take*r your*r bill,*r and*r sit*r down*r quickly*r and*r write*r fifty.’*r
Then*r he*r said*r to*r another,*r ‘And*r how*r much*r do*r you*r owe?’*r He*r said,*r ‘A*r hundred*r measures*r of*r wheat.’*r He*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Take*r your*r bill,*r and*r write*r eighty.’*r

The*r master*r commended*r the*r dishonest*r manager*r for*r his*r shrewdness.*r For*r the*r sons*r of*r this*r world*r are*r more*r shrewd*r in*r dealing*r with*r their*r own*r generation*r than*r the*r sons*r of*r light.*r
And*r I*r tell*r you,*r make*r friends*r for*r yourselves*r by*r means*r of*r unrighteous*r wealth,*r so*r that*r when*r it*r fails*r they*r may*r receive*r you*r into*r the*r eternal*r dwellings.*r
“One*rp who*r is*r faithful*r in*r a*r very*r little*r is*r also*r faithful*r in*r much,*r and*r one*r who*r is*r dishonest*r in*r a*r very*r little*r is*r also*r dishonest*r in*r much.*r
If*r then*r you*r have*r not*r been*r faithful*r in*r the*r unrighteous*r wealth,*r who*r will*r entrust*r to*r you*r the*r true*r riches?*r
And*r if*r you*r have*r not*r been*r faithful*r in*r that*r which*r is*r another’s,*r who*r will*r give*r you*r that*r which*r is*r your*r own?*r

No*r servant*r can*r serve*r two*r masters,*r for*r either*r he*r will*r hate*r the*r one*r and*r love*r the*r other,*r or*r he*r will*r be*r devoted*r to*r the*r one*r and*r despise*r the*r other.*r You*r cannot*r serve*r God*r and*r money.”*r
The Law and the Kingdom of God
The*p Pharisees, who were lovers of money, heard all these things, and they ridiculed him.

And he said to them, “You*r are*r those*r who*r justify*r yourselves*r before*r men,*r but*r God*r knows*r your*r hearts.*r For*r what*r is*r exalted*r among*r men*r is*r an*r abomination*r in*r the*r sight*r of*r God.*r
“The*rp Law*r and*r the*r Prophets*r were*r until*r John;*r since*r then*r the*r good*r news*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r preached,*r and*r everyone*r forces*r his*r way*r into*r it.*r
But*r it*r is*r easier*r for*r heaven*r and*r earth*r to*r pass*r away*r than*r for*r one*r dot*r of*r the*r Law*r to*r become*r void.*r
Divorce and Remarriage
“Everyone*rp who*r divorces*r his*r wife*r and*r marries*r another*r commits*r adultery,*r and*r he*r who*r marries*r a*r woman*r divorced*r from*r her*r husband*r commits*r adultery.*r
The Rich Man and Lazarus
“There*rp was*r a*r rich*r man*r who*r was*r clothed*r in*r purple*r and*r fine*r linen*r and*r who*r feasted*r sumptuously*r every*r day.*r
And*r at*r his*r gate*r was*r laid*r a*r poor*r man*r named*r Lazarus,*r covered*r with*r sores,*r
who*r desired*r to*r be*r fed*r with*r what*r fell*r from*r the*r rich*r man’s*r table.*r Moreover,*r even*r the*r dogs*r came*r and*r licked*r his*r sores.*r
The*r poor*r man*r died*r and*r was*r carried*r by*r the*r angels*r to*r Abraham’s*r side.*r The*r rich*r man*r also*r died*r and*r was*r buried,*r
and*r in*r Hades,*r being*r in*r torment,*r he*r lifted*r up*r his*r eyes*r and*r saw*r Abraham*r far*r off*r and*r Lazarus*r at*r his*r side.*r

And*r he*r called*r out,*r ‘Father*r Abraham,*r have*r mercy*r on*r me,*r and*r send*r Lazarus*r to*r dip*r the*r end*r of*r his*r finger*r in*r water*r and*r cool*r my*r tongue,*r for*r I*r am*r in*r anguish*r in*r this*r flame.’*r

But*r Abraham*r said,*r ‘Child,*r remember*r that*r you*r in*r your*r lifetime*r received*r your*r good*r things,*r and*r Lazarus*r in*r like*r manner*r bad*r things;*r but*r now*r he*r is*r comforted*r here,*r and*r you*r are*r in*r anguish.*r

And*r besides*r all*r this,*r between*r us*r and*r you*r a*r great*r chasm*r has*r been*r fixed,*r in*r order*r that*r those*r who*r would*r pass*r from*r here*r to*r you*r may*r not*r be*r able,*r and*r none*r may*r cross*r from*r there*r to*r us.’*r
And*r he*r said,*r ‘Then*r I*r beg*r you,*r father,*r to*r send*r him*r to*r my*r father’s*r house—*r
for*r I*r have*r five*r brothers—*r so*r that*r he*r may*r warn*r them,*r lest*r they*r also*r come*r into*r this*r place*r of*r torment.’*r
But*r Abraham*r said,*r ‘They*r have*r Moses*r and*r the*r Prophets;*r let*r them*r hear*r them.’*r
And*r he*r said,*r ‘No,*r father*r Abraham,*r but*r if*r someone*r goes*r to*r them*r from*r the*r dead,*r they*r will*r repent.’*r
He*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘If*r they*r do*r not*r hear*r Moses*r and*r the*r Prophets,*r neither*r will*r they*r be*r convinced*r if*r someone*r should*r rise*r from*r the*r dead.’”*r
